rev.comment: Reverted edit of 193.71.148.67, changed back to last version by Grover cleveland
/* Questions of reliability */ The Comma Johanneum and Pericope Adulterae are found in manuscripts going back to the 3rd to 5th centuries -- therefore not "medieval". See articles on those topics
/* Resurrection and Ascension */ typo
/* Resurrection and Ascension */ John does not state that Thomas actually touched Jesus's side
/* Historicity of the texts */YACE

/* Life and teachings based on the Gospels */ Lost sheep of the house of Israel
removing extra line breaks (this always happens after I move sections).
/* Christian views */ moved from below
/* Other views arising from early Christianity */ moving to "Christian views"
/* Other forms of Christianity arising in the first and second centuries */ Shorter title.
nothing wrong with redirects, are you suggesting all "BCE" links should now become "BC" so as not to redirect? (There are no actual BCE year articles on Wiki)
avoid redirect
/* Other forms of Christianity arising in the first and second centuries */ "Messiah" meant various things in the first century. Not necessarily what it means to Jews now.
/* Other forms of Christianity arising in the first and second centuries */ Title is less awkward than before, but a bit long. "Messiah" is better than "Jewish Messiah" because it's broader.
/* Forensic reconstructions of Jesus's life */
2nd paragraph grammar edit typo
/* Other views */
